channel.title: Databricks on Niels Berglund
channel.description: Recent content in Databricks on Niels Berglund

item.title: Interesting Stuff - Week 29, 2023
item.description:
ðŸ“š Explore the latest tech wonders and data-driven innovations in this week’s blog post!

From empowering analysts with Azure Data Explorer to estimating customer lifetime value through Lakehouse architecture, and the exciting Databricks-MosaicML collaboration democratizing generative AI.

Delve into the best sessions of Kafka Summit London 2023 and discover how Confluent revolutionizes real-time order notifications for businesses.

Plus, don’t miss the impressive lineup of industry experts and sessions at Data Saturday Durban! Join us as we journey through the fascinating world of technology and data insights! ðŸŒŸ

item.title: Interesting Stuff - Week 26, 2023
item.description:
We’ve got everything from data pipelines to streaming platforms in this week’s blog post: Hoptimator, the tool designed to streamline and optimize data pipelines. Mobile Premier League (MPL) and how they reduced player churn using Confluent Cloud. Materialized views and streaming tables for Databricks SQL.

Finally, Data Saturday Durban on August 19. It is still time to submit a talk.

item.title: Interesting Stuff - Week 17, 2023
item.description:
This week: beating roulette, hooking up Azure Data Explorer and Kafka. Real-time machine learning pipelines.

Spark loader for Hugging Face datasets, processing data from multiple streaming platforms using Delta Live Tables and the real-time streaming ecosystem.

item.title: Interesting Stuff - Week 16, 2023
item.description:
A mixed bag this week: Azure Databricks and its Delta engine. In Azure Data Explorer “land” a combined Kusto Sink Connector and Kafka Connect image targeting multi-platform. Databricks has released MLflow 2.3 with new interesting features.

Speaking of Databricks; new functions in Databricks SQL allowing integration of large language models (LLMs) into SQL queries. Oh, and let’s not forget using Generative AI to create Synthetic Data.

item.title: Interesting Stuff - Week 15, 2023
item.description:
Some very exciting things this week: Generative AI may shift focus from technology-driven to product-driven development. A game analytics framework/solution to help game developers analyze players. How to use synthetic data in ML.

How to handle late-arriving events in Apache Flink. An introduction to materialized views and how they can help. Also, a plug for an upcoming post by me about how to build multi-platform Docker images.

item.title: Interesting Stuff - Week 30, 2022
item.description:
Throughout the week, I read a lot of blog-posts, articles, and so forth that has to do with things that interest me:

  • AI/data science
  • data in general
  • data architecture
  • streaming
  • distributed computing
  • SQL Server
  • transactions (both db as well as non db)
  • and other “stuff”

This blog post is the “roundup” of the things that have been most interesting to me for the week just ending.
